subsection_content:
Usually, right after a baby is born, the doctor can detect whether or not hypospadias is present. The severity of this deformity is classified as follows:
Mild form (Anterior form): The urinary opening is located at the glans, notch of the glans.; Medium body (Middle body): The urinary opening is located at the shaft of the penis; Severe form (Posterior form): The urinary opening is located at the base of the penis, scrotum, and perineum.
Usually, boys with hypospadias do not have difficulty urinating. However, in some severe cases, the patient may have to urinate sitting down or have difficulty having sex in the future. In particular, children with hypospadias and curved penis are susceptible to infertility. (2)
subsection_title: lo tieu lech thap.json. Types of hypospadias locations
